meanings.definition: Excessively particular or demanding in taste or standards.
meanings.sent1: She is hyperfastidious about the cleanliness of her room, always organizing and dusting.
meanings.sent2: The hyperfastidious eater would only dine at Michelin-starred restaurants.
meanings.sent3: The hyperfastidious cat refused to eat the food unless it was served in a specific bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperfastidious nature when it comes to choosing clothes makes shopping a long and tedious process.
meanings.sent5: The hyperfastidious judge could spot even the tiniest errors in the legal documents.

meanings.definition: Showing extreme attention to detail or cleanliness.
meanings.sent1: The hyperfastidious artist spent hours perfecting every brushstroke on the painting.
meanings.sent2: She was hyperfastidious about keeping her workspace organized and clutter-free.
meanings.sent3: The hyperfastidious gardener meticulously pruned each plant in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His hyperfastidious approach to car maintenance ensured that his vehicle always looked brand new.
meanings.sent5: The hyperfastidious editor never missed a single typo in the manuscript.
